Dalam 9 Bulan, Pemerintah Sudah Terbitkan Utang Baru Rp 317 T
04 Nov 2019, 14:15 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Dok. Kementerian PUPR

Jakarta - Kementerian Keuangan tercatat telah menerbitkan utang baru sebesar RP 317,7 triliun hingga akhir September 2019. Angka penerbitan utang tersebut naik 3,7 persen dibandingkan periode yang sama tahun lalu sebesar Rp 306,4 triliun.Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengungkapkan bahwa pengelolaan utang yang dilakukan Pemerintah sesuai dengan prinsip kehati-hatian."Kita tetap menjaga prinsip kehati-hatian, kita tetap jaga agar efisiensi biaya utang tetap bisa dikendalikan sesuai tren secara internasional dan advented ekonomi kita sendiri," kata Sri Mulyani di ruang rapat Komisi XI DPR, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Realisasi penerbitan utang sampai September 2019 itu naik signifikan yaitu sebesar 21,2 persen dibandingkan pada posisi yang sama di September 2018.Meski demikian, Mantan Direktur Pelaksana Bank Dunia ini memastikan bahwa rasio utang Pemerintah terhadap PDB masih berada di level aman. Dia bilang, sampai saat ini rasio utang Pemerintah di level 30% terhadap PDB.Angka rasio tersebut masih jauh dari ketentuan UU Keuangan Negara yang maksimal 60% dari PDB. Bahkan, dirinya mengungkapkan bahwa rasio utang Idonesia masih rendah dibandingkan Jepang dan Singapura."Kalau dilihat level rasio kita dibandingkan Filipina dan negara advance yang bahkan mencapai 100% rasionya terhadap GDP, ekstremnya seperti Jepang bisa mencapai 200%, 113% seperti Singapura, dan negara Malaysia sekalipun juga mengalami rasio utang di atas 50% dari ekonominya," ungkap dia. Within 9 Months, the Government Has Issued New Debt of Rp. 317 T
Nov 04 2019, 14:15 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Doc. Ministry of PUPR

Jakarta - The Ministry of Finance has recorded a new debt of Rp 317.7 trillion until the end of September 2019. The debt issuance figure increased by 3.7 percent compared to the same period last year of Rp 306.4 trillion. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati revealed that the management the debt carried out by the Government is in accordance with the precautionary principle. "We still maintain the precautionary principle, we continue to keep the efficiency of debt costs can be controlled according to international trends and advented our own economy," Sri Mulyani said in the DPR's Commission XI meeting room. , Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019). The realization of debt issuance until September 2019 increased significantly by 21.2 percent compared to the same position in September 2018. Even so, the Former Managing Director of the World Bank ensured that the Government's debt ratio to GDP is still at a safe level. He said, to date the Government debt ratio is at the level of 30% to GDP. The ratio is still far from the provisions of the State Finance Law which is a maximum of 60% of GDP. In fact, he revealed that Indonesia's debt ratio is still low compared to Japan and Singapore. "If we look at the level of our ratio compared to the Philippines and advanced countries which even reach 100% of their ratio to GDP, extremes like Japan can reach 200%, 113% like Singapore, and other countries Even Malaysia also has a debt ratio above 50% of its economy, "he said.
